column1: This is a list of earthquakes in 2000. Only earthquakes of magnitude 6 or above are included
column2: unless they result in damage and/or casualties
column3: or are notable for some other reason.  All dates are listed according to UTC time.

column1: Note that an increase in detected earthquake numbers does not necessarily represent an increase in earthquakes per se. Population increase
column2: habitation spread
column3: and advances in earthquake detection technology all contribute to higher earthquake numbers being recorded over time.  USGS's Earthquake Myths has more information.

column1: For exact dates and live earthquakes please visit USGS's Global Earthquake Search Page and Real-time Earthquake Map or EMSC's Real-time Seismicity.
